185910317.review:
Human Revolution features all the staples of a modern immersive sim game: a choice of combat or stealth, a world that reacts to the player, and a really good story. While I much preferred the more modern graphics, gunplay, and mechanics of Mankind Divided, the story here was most definitely superior. It was philosophical and thought-provoking, combining all the most intriguing parts of the cyberpunk genre.

The shooter mechanics were quite rough for a game of this era, but that wasn't much of an issue on my stealth playthrough. Furthermore, the "Director's Cut" is a step in the wrong direction - as is the case most of the time. Even on a high end PC, the game hitched incessantly to the point that I had to use mods to clean it up. Furthermore, the included ~3 hour DLC is shoe-horned into the main campaign, obliterating the otherwise stellar pacing of the base game.

Gripes aside, Deux Ex is a special series and Human Revolution is a worthy entry in the franchise. The deep and brooding story helps to carry the game past some of it's more surface-level flaws.

185905640.review:
As a prequel to Deus Ex it embodies the bloat and sanitizing of AAA game design goals, but even taken as its own standalone experience there's a lot of weak links in Human Revolution. The bizarre attempt to make augmentation an every-metaphor for medication-dependency in the United States, to racial oppression, to an arm's race in labour depression among workers... to the Big Ol' Singularity - it just doesn't work. The original Deus Ex and for that matter most of it's inspiration (Authours like Gibson, D*ck, etc) depicted rich worlds with a tapestry of things going on within them, I understood they badly wanted to run their "No, it's like Detroit's automobile market!!" beat into the ground but for god's sake, if you're making a story about the entire span of political issues in your video game about Making Choices, try to imagine for a moment that any of the issues could be more complicated than "Robot Arm Good?? Or Robot Arm, Bad??? Much to think about"

Also for god's sake, I know video games refuse to treat their players with real conviction about their choices, but it's so lazy that "non-lethal" playstyles in this game are just a button prompt difference. Adam Jensen straight up clocking a man with his robot arms is probably more likely to be lethal than just stabbing them once through the torso with his arm blades! Why are we so unwilling to build games where having moral conviction actually takes work, if the only thing stopping the player from being Batman is which key they choose to press when attacking you haven't created any player choice or roleplaying!

185654625.review:
A Visionary Game Hampered by Flaws

Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut aims to deliver a deep, immersive cyberpunk experience, and while it gets some things right, it’s weighed down by outdated mechanics, inconsistent design choices, and a story that doesn’t quite live up to its ambitions.

On the surface, the game has a lot going for it. The art direction is fantastic, with a striking black-and-gold aesthetic that sets the tone for a world steeped in corporate greed, transhumanism, and moral ambiguity. The soundtrack is equally impressive, with haunting, atmospheric tracks that fit the cyberpunk vibe perfectly. However, once you get past the presentation, the cracks start to show.

The gameplay feels clunky and dated. While the mix of stealth, hacking, and combat sounds appealing in theory, none of these systems feel polished or satisfying. The stealth mechanics can be frustratingly inconsistent—sometimes enemies spot you from unrealistic distances, while other times you can practically walk right in front of them without consequence. Combat, on the other hand, is stiff and lacks the fluidity of more modern action games.

The hacking mini-game, while fun at first, becomes repetitive and overused. It feels like a chore after the first few hours, especially since so many key interactions are locked behind this mechanic. Similarly, the augmentations system, which should allow for creative and flexible playstyles, often feels limited in practice, with certain upgrades being much more useful than others.

The Director’s Cut promised improved boss fights, but they’re still one of the game’s weakest points. These encounters force you into combat-heavy situations that completely disregard stealth-based builds, undermining the idea of player choice that the game tries so hard to promote. Even with the supposed fixes, these fights feel out of place and poorly designed.

The story, while intriguing, falls short of its potential. Adam Jensen is a solid protagonist, but the supporting cast is bland and forgettable. The game tackles interesting themes like corporate corruption and the ethics of augmentation, but these ideas are often presented in a heavy-handed way that lacks nuance. The narrative choices you make throughout the game don’t feel impactful, and the endings boil down to pressing a button to decide the fate of the world—a disappointing conclusion to an otherwise ambitious setup.

Technically, the Director’s Cut is also a mixed bag. While some improvements were made over the original release, such as better lighting and integration of the DLC, the game still suffers from bugs, awkward animations, and inconsistent AI behavior. The loading times can be long, and the overall polish is lacking for a game that’s been re-released as a definitive edition.

Ultimately, Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut is a game with great ideas but flawed execution. While it might still appeal to hardcore cyberpunk fans or those nostalgic for the franchise, its clunky mechanics, underwhelming story, and frustrating design choices make it a tough recommendation in today’s gaming landscape.

185619501.review:
There are major design flaws in this game that are caused by RNG and inconsistency regarding not only the core game play but reloading auto saves can be horrendous at times. You can be making your way into an area and hit a spot that is tricky and needs an autosave, usually it will autosave you in a place it should as it keeps up with your progress but then some times it will decide to screw you over by placing you so far back and then even those same autosaves will move it's timestamp by like a minute instead of how long it took you to get where you were. But while that's tolerable at best... the Missing Link DLC is placed within the game and it shows up as a continuation of the main story without warning which if it shows what happens in between certain points then great. BUT THEN ALL YOUR PRAXIS PROGRESS, ALL THE TEDIOUS HOURS YOU SPENT SAVING UP SUPPLIES AND BUYING ENOUGH INVENTORY SPACE WAS FOR ABSOLUTELY NOTHING CAUSE INSTEAD OF THE GAME GIVING BACK ALL YOUR UPGRADES IT ACTS AS THOUGH THE DLC WAS IT'S OWN SEPARATE THING MEANING ALL THAT TIME WAS WASTED... I actually might stop playing entirely cause that is Completely Unfair.

The rest of the game was good but Jesus Christ that really sucks. Be prepared to hate living for a sec if you're doing pacifist run btw.

185152565.review:
Deus Ex: Human Revolution is a masterclass in blending narrative depth, engaging gameplay, and futuristic aesthetics.
Eidos Montreal crafted a game that not only pays homage to the original Deus Ex but also establishes itself as a standout experience in its own right. 
From its gripping story to its polished mechanics, Human Revolution is a triumph of immersive design.
The game’s story is one of its greatest strengths, weaving a thought-provoking narrative about transhumanism, corporate greed, and the ethical dilemmas of technological advancement. 
Playing as Adam Jensen, a security specialist turned reluctant hero after a near-fatal attack, you’re thrust into a world where augmentations blur the line between human and machine! 
The story’s branching paths and moral choices ensure that every decision feels meaningful, making you question not just the characters' motives but your own as well.
Stealth gameplay is another highlight, offering a rewarding mix of strategy and adaptability. 
Whether you’re sneaking through vents, disabling cameras, or silently taking down guards, the game provides countless ways to approach each scenario. 
The flexibility to shift between stealth and combat allows players to tailor their experience to their preferred playstyle, making every encounter feel fresh and engaging.
The augmentation mechanics are the crown jewel of Human Revolution, adding layers of depth to both gameplay and storytelling. 
Upgrading Adam’s abilities, from hacking and cloaking to enhanced vision and strength, feels both empowering and thematically resonant. 
Each new augmentation unlocks creative solutions to challenges, encouraging experimentation and rewarding exploration.
The atmospheric soundtrack further immerses you in this dystopian world, blending electronic tones with haunting melodies.
While Deus Ex: Human Revolution isn’t without its minor flaws, the boss battles can feel out of place compared to the rest of the game’s design, they’re overshadowed by the sheer brilliance of everything else on offer. 
This is a game that respects its players, challenging them to think critically while providing the tools to play creatively.
Whether you’re a fan of stealth games, rich narratives, or cyberpunk worlds, Deus Ex: Human Revolution is a must-play!

185040857.review:
Deus Ex Human Revolution - Director's Cut - Прекрасная игра. Я проходил её много раз. Оцениваю на 8/10.

--------------- Плюсы: ---------------
◻️ Интересный и вариативный геймплей. Мне нравится когда дают свободу в геймплее. Как хочешь, так и играешь. 
◻️ Игру любопытно исследовать. Я облазил практически каждый угол, чтобы ничего не упустить.
◻️ Можно прокачивать главного героя. Большинство имплантов очень полезные. Мои любимые это: Икар и маскировка, 
◻️ Есть достижения. Будет чем заняться после прохождения игры.
◻️ В игре есть режим "Новая игра+". Я люблю этот режим в играх. Мне всегда интересно пройти повторно игру ещё раз, но уже прокачанным героем.
◻️ Игра работает стабильно без багов и зависаний.
◻️ Хорошая оптимизация. Игра запускается даже на моём стареньком ноутбуке.
◻️ Любопытный сюжет.
◻️ Красивые катсцены. Смотришь как будто фильм.
◻️ Неплохая стрельба. Оружием пользоваться приятно, но хотелось бы больше крови и мяса. Оружие можно улучшать модулями: глушитель и лцу. А также повышать характеристики стволов.
◻️ Игра имеет полный дубляж. Так намного приятнее погружаться в игровой мир. Но в Стиме как обычно она отсутствует. Приходится ставить всё в ручную.
◻️ Красивые добивания в ближнем бою. 
 
--------------- Минусы: ---------------
◻️ Энергия очень быстро расходуется, даже когда Дженсен полностью прокачан. 
◻️ Вроде будущее, вроде крутые технологии, вроде главный герой не беден, а с восстановлением батарей огромные проблемы. В игре крайне мало способов восстановить энергию. Батончики которые дают энергию попадаются очень редко и это при том, что я обыскиваю каждый угол и подбираю всё что вижу. А в магазинах за всю игру только пару банок продавалось. Как пользоваться способностями, если нет энергии... Пожалуй, это самый большой минус в игре.
◻️ Очень и очень не хватает имплантов на скорость перезарядки оружия. Практически всё оружие в игре медленно делает перезарядку.
◻️ Сбитый прицел у револьвера после улучшений. Когда нажимаешь правую кнопку мыши, чтобы прицелиться, то видишь, что прицел сбит. Пули летят намного ниже. И чтобы попасть из прицельного режима нужно очень низко опустить прицел относительно цели. Если стрелять из револьвера с лазерным целе указателем от бедра, то пули летят точно в цель.
◻️ Хотелось бы более интересную мини игру по взлому. Чтобы нужно было включать голову для того, чтобы решить задачку. А так не особо весело полагаться в игре на вероятности обнаружения. От тебя мало что зависит. Всё решает вероятность.
◻️ Нельзя хранить в инвентаре одинаковое оружие. У меня в инвентаре есть дробовик, если я подниму ещё один, то мне просто дадут пару патронов. Это очень тупо. Приходится много раз бегать туда-сюда, чтобы продать всё найденное оружие.
◻️ Некоторые моменты не проработаны. Например можно зайти в любой магазин и взять всё что тебе хочется. Или взломать сейф в магазине перед носом продавца и забрать содержимое. Последствий абсолютно никаких. Никто даже и слова не скажет.
◻️ Мир игры очень серьёзный. Нет ни одной комичной сцены или диалога. Даже в тёмные времена люди любят шутить, чтобы немного расслабиться. 
очень медленно перезаряжается.
◻️ В игре долгие загрузки. Иногда хочется поэкспериментировать с врагами, применить разные способности и оружие. Из-за чего приходится часто пользоваться Быстрой загрузкой. Забавно, что она совсем не быстрая. Утомительно ждать загрузки.

드래곤 에이지 오리진의 인간 귀족 스타트,  메기솔 리벤전스와 같이 강렬한 스타트를 참 좋아하는데 이 작품의 시작도 같은 결이라고 보시면 됩니다.

다만 엔딩 본지 오래지만 전투는 확실히 별로였던 기억이 있습니다.
번역 퀄리티 아주 훌륭한 한패가 있으니 시간이 많이 지난 지금도 강추하는 게임입니다.

근데 왜 플탐 카운트가 4시간 밖에 안됐는지 의문이네요. 꽤 긴 시간 플레이 했었는데 말입니다.

184958214.review:
Alright Spoiler Free review.
The game can be played without prior knowledge of the og Deus Ex without missing out.

The good:
It's a Deus Ex game
The story
~30 hours of gameplay
My vision is augmented

The bad.
The game was definitely developed with consoles in mind and accustoming yourself to that inital jank might take a while.
The hacking minigame, it's bad and you need to use it quite often.
And last but not least the walking. While there are open world elements at times the amount of actual things to do or interesting places is quite small, so most of the time you'll just be running a lot. (shanghai/Hengsha) I think at least one or two hours of my gameplay was dedicated to running from place to place.

If you can see past the bad things then I strongly believe you'll enjoy the game as it is rich in story elements with interesting secrets to uncover. The gameplay isn't bad either, enemy placement is fair most of the time and your options to complete objectives are numerous.

It costs $20 but it goes on sale regularly, I recommend it either way.

184955092.review:
Deus Ex: Human Revolution è stato un viaggio incredibile in un futuro distopico dove tecnologia e umanità si scontrano. Ho trovato la storia profondamente stimolante, con Adam Jensen, un protagonista complesso, che indaga su una cospirazione globale legata agli impianti cibernetici.  

Quello che ho amato di più è la libertà di scelta: ho potuto affrontare ogni missione come preferivo, alternando furtività, hacking e azione diretta. Il sistema di potenziamenti cibernetici è fantastico, permettendo di adattare il gameplay al mio stile, e l’ambientazione cyberpunk, tra Detroit e Hengsha, è semplicemente spettacolare.  

Anche la colonna sonora è perfetta, con brani elettronici che immergono completamente nel mondo futuristico. L’unico neo? I combattimenti con i boss, che forzano un approccio meno flessibile rispetto al resto del gioco.  

In definitiva, Human Revolution mi ha conquistato con la sua trama, libertà e atmosfera. È un’esperienza che consiglio a chi ama i giochi di ruolo e la fantascienza.

184925341.review:
[h3] ..используя технологии для дополнительных возможностей, мы рискуем потерять способность любить, стремиться к лучшему и поступать правильно. А ведь именно это и делает нас людьми. [/h3]
Я поклонник иммёрсив симов. Мне нравится проверять игры на прочность, смотреть насколько игра позволяет наглеть в том или ином случае - и Deus Ex сильно меня удивил в этом плане. Было очень весело загружать последний квиксейв и смотреть, как и что ещё можно делать для достижения той или иной цели. Жутко весело.
[b]Потрясающая проработка вселенной.[/b] По началу очень удивляло, что компьютер с третьим уровнем блокировки совершенно не содержит ничего полезного для вас и выполнения вашей миссии, за то будет содержать сообщения о том, как учёный постоянно ловит вирусы из-за просмотра порнографии на своём компьютере:)
Все эти газеты и книги очень сильно погружают вас в реальность происходящего. За это жирнющий плюс.
[b]Сюжет отличный,[/b] следить за происходящим очень интересно, особенно ближе к концу.
[b]Геймплей просто потрясающий.[/b] Самому трудновато описать конкретные особенности, но я уверен, что упоминание жанра иммёрсив сим вам точно о чём-нибудь говорит, так что ноги в руки и бегом проходить!
[b]Из минусов[/b] отмечу удаление английского языка в вашей системе после выхода из игры, приходилось переустанавливать его каждый божий раз.

184863893.review:
[b]Deus Ex - это цикл компьютерных игр, который начал свою историю еще летом 2000 года.[/b]
Сюжетно игры увлекательны с самого начала. Но вот в плане графики первой очень эффектной, на мой взгляд, является данная Deus Ex: Human Revolution.
Решил о ней написать, потому что спустя несколько лет с удовольствием в нее опять поиграл. И даже не один раз, а для того, чтобы вспомнить различия, проиграл трижды на всех уровнях сложности. Да, этих уровней три.

[b]О чем игра?[/b] Да о жизни людей в недалеком будущем. Всего лишь двадцатые годы нашего 21 века. Но уже высокие технологии - огромное количество имплантов самых разных органов человеческого тела. Правда, это еще не повсеместно. В основном, это в стадиях разработок и усовершенствований.
Но главный персонаж, за которого и проходим игру, Адам Дженсен, снабжен такими имплантами по полной. Киборг, можно сказать, но с человеческим лицом и душой.

[b]Кроме отличной графики и сюжет очень интересный. Я не люблю длинные диалоги и здесь разговоров, на мой взгляд, в меру. Разговоры не пустые. Вопросы-ответы. И необходимость делать выбор создает вполне реальное ощущение участия в событиях.[/b]
Ну и вообще речь-то о спасении Планеты и Человечества.
Несколько локаций в разных странах. Это и США, и Канада, и Китай, и Австралия.
Управление игрой не сложное и понятное. Музыкальное сопровождение не навязчивое. В общем, комфортное состояние во время игры обеспечено.
По уровням сложности не могу назвать особых ярких отличий. Наверное, просто труднее находить боеприпасы. И враги более беспощадные. А так вполне можно сразу начинать играть на сложном уровне. Всегда есть возможность пройти любую ситуацию.
[b]Отличная игра. Рекомендую любителям с ней познакомиться. Даже на фоне современных она очень не плохо выглядит.[/b]

184820040.review:
[b]Deus Ex: Human Revolution is a hallmark of immersive gaming, blending thrilling gameplay, deep storytelling, and philosophical questions about humanity, technology, and ethics. As a prequel to the original Deus Ex (2000), this title modernizes the series while preserving its roots in player agency and world-building. It remains one of the finest cyberpunk experiences to date.[/b]

[h1]A Rich and Engaging Cyberpunk World[/h1]
[b]The year is 2027, and the world is on the cusp of a technological revolution. Corporations have become the true powers of the world, and human augmentation, the fusion of man and machine, is both a miracle and a threat. This setting is brought to life through gorgeous art direction and a moody soundtrack that perfectly captures the dystopian cyberpunk aesthetic. Cities like Detroit and Hengsha are teeming with life, mystery, and moral ambiguity, making every exploration feel significant.[/b]

[h1]A Story of Choice and Consequence[/h1]
[b]You play as Adam Jensen, a former SWAT officer turned augmented security specialist for Sarif Industries. After surviving a brutal attack, Jensen’s body is rebuilt with advanced augmentations, plunging him into a conspiracy that spans the globe.
The narrative weaves themes of post-humanism, corporate power, and human morality into a story that is both personal and thought-provoking. The choices you make, whether in dialogue or action, carry weight, shaping the outcome of missions and influencing the lives of those around you.[/b]

[h1]Stealth, Combat, and Freedom of Playstyle[/h1]
[b]The hallmark of Human Revolution is its commitment to player choice. Whether you prefer hacking your way into secure areas, sneaking past guards unnoticed, or engaging in direct combat, the game accommodates your playstyle. Augmentations, like cloaking devices or enhanced hacking capabilities, allow you to further customize your approach.
The stealth mechanics are particularly satisfying, with the level design encouraging creativity and exploration. Combat is equally engaging, offering a mix of cover-based gunplay and tactical strategy. No matter how you play, the game rewards ingenuity and adaptability.[/b]

[h1]Augmentations: Tools for Empowerment[/h1]
[b]The augmentation system is a core aspect of the gameplay and narrative. Each upgrade you unlock feels impactful, allowing you to tailor Adam’s abilities to suit your preferred playstyle. Want to silently take down enemies? Invest in stealth augmentations. Prefer hacking into terminals and uncovering secrets? Focus on your hacking upgrades. This flexibility enhances replayability and ensures that no two playthroughs feel the same.[/b]

[h1]Philosophy Meets Action[/h1]
[b]Deus Ex: Human Revolution is not just an action RPG; it’s a thought experiment. The game raises questions about what it means to be human in a world where technology blurs the line between man and machine. Is augmentation a gift or a curse? Do the ends justify the means when wielding such power? These questions are explored through the narrative, environmental storytelling, and player choices, ensuring the game leaves a lasting impression long after you’ve finished it.[/b]

[h1]Visuals and Atmosphere[/h1]
[b]While the graphics might show their age compared to modern games, the art direction more than makes up for it. The use of black and gold creates a unique visual identity that exudes both technological progress and decay. The atmospheric soundtrack by Michael McCann complements the tone perfectly, immersing you in a world of tension and mystery.[/b]

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Engaging narrative: A thought-provoking story with compelling themes.
[*]Freedom of choice: Multiple paths and playstyles encourage replayability.
[*]Deep world-building: A richly detailed cyberpunk universe with meaningful environmental storytelling.
[*]Augmentation system: Customization that makes every upgrade feel impactful.
[*]Memorable soundtrack: The music amplifies the atmosphere and tension.
[*]Moral complexity: The game challenges players to think critically about their decisions.
[/list]
[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Boss fights: The boss battles feel out of place, forcing combat in a game that thrives on choice.
[*]Dated visuals: While the art direction shines, the graphics show their age in certain areas.
[*]Pacing issues: Some missions feel unnecessarily drawn out.
[*]Lack of accessibility in some mechanics: Certain augmentations or paths can feel underwhelming if you miss upgrading them early.
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
[b]Deus Ex: Human Revolution is a game that stands as a benchmark for storytelling, player agency, and immersive design. Despite some flaws, its narrative depth and freedom of choice make it a must-play for fans of cyberpunk, RPGs, and thought-provoking gaming experiences.
For those seeking a game that combines action, philosophy, and a world worth exploring, Deus Ex: Human Revolution is an unforgettable journey.[/b]

184724253.review:
Truly a flawed masterpiece.  The boss fights at the end of each major story progression throughout the game are terrible (That fight in Eliza's chamber was the worst of any I've ever seen from an immersive sim)  There's also a bit of bugs and jankiness to the NPCs on occasion; how they move, what they can and can't detect, etc.  It's not a polished game by any means.

          This is where my complaints end though, because I adore this game.  Not only is this a fantastic immersive sim, but it's up there with being one of my top favorites for stealth shooters all-together.  I rarely ever see level design so uniquely considerate to tailor the player's progression. For example, you won't see exploits of crawlspaces and hacking terminals to disable robotics come easy every time.  They make you work for it towards the end of the game, they make you learn how to change your play style...  They make you better for it.

          The variety of augments that you acquire in the game are also done well, there's not much you can do without their reliance.  Around the third act of the game, you're THEN expected to function with them stripped from you until the mission ENDS.  This was ingenious, as then now the game expects you to have learned enough about your enemies to work with the minimum.

          Adam Jensen is such a badass too honestly.  For real, what a kick ass cyberpunk stealth shooting immersive sim.  One of my all-time favorites, even if it has it's imperfections.

184703544.review:
Not as great as the original Deus Ex, but definitely a great game that pays a lot of homage to its predecessor and can tell the devs had fun making the game and telling its story with lovely characters. 

Though I have have found myself missing mechanics from the OG, as well as not being fond of some of the newer ones like the hacking minigames, conversation battles that felt out of place especially with how the confusing social augment so i just followed a guide, and then there is shoving my face full of bars if I wanted to do more than a couple takedowns. I miss just turning on a few augs and being a relentless badass with a Chinese lightsaber.


In other words go play Deus Ex

184683099.review:
I *did* ask for this.
Deus Ex: Human Revolution is easily one of the best in the series. From the four pillars of player choice (hacking, combat, stealth, social) to the goofy story (muh Illuminati), the game is never boring and always entertaining. Michael McCann's soundtrack keeps you relaxed or on your toes dependent on your situation. The atmosphere and design of the game are one of the reasons I come back again and again.

For the cons, the character models look dated, some of the voice acting is a bit choppy (including their movements), and the Missing Link DLC, while adding to the overall story, brings the main story to a sudden jarring halt.

Other than that, become more human than human and download this game.

184477291.review:
Adam Jensen是我最喜欢的虚拟人物之一，ACRONYM设计的帅气风衣和满身的科技义体只是其中一个原因。
真正让我喜欢上他的，是他并不将自己置于某个俯瞰的高位，对人类保持着理性和谦卑的态度。
“每一次我都抵御住了诱惑，因为我重视人的生命和人道关怀。”
他并不相信有人能单方面为人类做出选择，因为事实上，我们在做出选择时，总会受到个人视觉的局限；休达罗片面的认为科技进步会摧毁人类的道德，可他就是错的吗？又或者说，沙里夫和塔格特也是错的吗？
并没有错，但也并不正确。没有人，也不该有人，代表一整个人类整体去做出举足轻重的选择。可我们又真的能鄙视那些为此而堕落的人吗？
然而历史却又不断警示我们，“群体”的思维很容易被少数精英影响，群体真的能在重大事务前做出正确的选择吗？
我想，唯一可能的出路，是提升我们的道德水平，只有人道关怀和对他人的尊重，才是救赎的恩典。即使一朝做出了错误的选择，我们的善意也会将它修正，让我们再次走上正确的道路。
可假设人类肆意让自己的恶意凌驾于善之上，不设身处地的将自己置于他人的位置上思考的话，那才会是真正的人类末日。

184299122.review:
This game came out back in 2011. its 2024 and I"d STILL recommend this game. Is it perfect? No, but was any game from 2011 perfect? Also no haha.
For today's standards its a but far behind, but if you're still on an older PC like DDR3? This is Still a great game. Highly recommend to anyone on an older system, or who just hasn't  played the game yet. For reference, I've got a REALLY good DDR3 system, but calling it outdated out be an under statement. Here is my specs

Specs
MotherBoard: Fatal1ty Z77 Professional
Storage - random 1TB SATA SSD
CPU: Intel I7-3770k
RAM- 32 Gig G.Skill Ripjaws X Series 32GB (4 x 8GB) 1600 MHz
GPU- A bit interesting, but it played OKAY with the Radeon HD 7770 2GB GDDR5
Was GREAT when I used the evga geforce gtx 760 SC
and had absolutely 0 problems when running a NVIDIA gtx 1660 super at max graphics 1080p 60 FPS

Either way, yes this is probably like the BEST DDR3 system you can get, but. If you have an older DDR3 system, you can still make it play some decent games like this. 

If your system is bad, or you haven't given this game a shot. Please do so. Been playing Mankind Divided, the sequel to Human revolution) with no problems, and Highly I recommend the sequel. 

 Played this game when it released on my Xbox 360 back in the day, and got stuck on the last boss due to a stupid in game feature where you can kinda just ruin the run. ill talk about that more soon, but don't go to the second half if you haven't played the game.  End your review reading here if you didn't play it yet. Please. 

Seriously. 

Why are you still Scrolling? 

*spoilers*

Last Chance.

Near the end of the game, you get the option to "upgrade your cyberlimbs" 
This seams like a great option, as your cyberlimbs start to malfunction and id probably take it again on my blind first playthrough. 
However this option makes the last boss ALMOST impossible unless you farmed TONS of Praxis, and is a requirement for the 100% achievement list. I hunted trophies/achievements a lot when i was younger and just straight gave up on this game.  

I know its 2024, but i gave this game another shot and it STILL holds up. The Environments could defiantly use a but more detail, but again. ITS 2011? Some games launch with worse graphics and stuff in 2024?

184163316.review:
My first immersive Sim, so I was pretty amused. So far I had a very pleasant experience and overall I can definetly recommend this game. Here are some pros and cons after having played most of the game.

Some Pros:
- Amazing graphics (especially considering this is a 2013 game)
- Nice combat / stealth
- Plot was intriguing
- Has multiple ways/paths to approach and reach the objective
- Gives you a lot of ability options (these can be a bit confusing at first)
- Characters and dialogue feels very refined
- AMAZING opening scene (seriously it is awesome, one of the best I have ever seen so far)
- Visual scenery is very cool and conveys the correct vibes

Some Cons:
- A few stutters when loading into new areas
- Overall mechanics can be a bit overwhelming at first (I recommend looking at a few guides when encountering them)
- Bosses can feel underwhelming
- Limited in what you can break / some abilities seem very rarely useful (seems to be a bit more restricted than then original Deus Ex)

183977174.review:
[h2]A Cyberpunk Masterpiece[/h2]
[b]Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut[/b] is an impressive action-RPG set in a cyberpunk world that combines deep role-playing mechanics with a gripping narrative and atmospheric world-building. Players experience a dystopian future where technological advancements and ethical dilemmas collide.

[h3]Strengths[/h3]
[b]Engaging Story:[/b] The narrative is complex and tackles themes like transhumanism, corruption, and the social impact of technological innovation. It challenges players morally and intellectually.

[b]Player Freedom:[/b] Whether through stealth, diplomacy, or direct confrontation, the game allows players to choose how to achieve their goals, making each mission unique.

[b]Excellent Level Design:[/b] Open yet structured areas encourage exploration and offer various creative approaches, especially for stealth enthusiasts.

[b]Timeless Atmosphere:[/b] With its distinctive gold-black color palette and immersive soundtrack, the game creates a dense cyberpunk vibe that remains captivating even today.

[b]Comprehensive Package:[/b] The Director's Cut includes all DLCs, seamlessly integrating them into the main story, along with improved boss fights that better accommodate different playstyles.

[h3]Weaknesses[/h3]
[b]Artificial Intelligence:[/b] Enemies often behave predictably, offering little challenge to experienced players, which can reduce the tension in stealth gameplay.

[b]Outdated Animations:[/b] Some character animations and cutscenes feel stiff and dated, slightly impacting immersion in certain moments.

[b]Clunky Interface:[/b] While functional, the interface can feel overloaded with menus and options, making navigation less intuitive.

[b]Limited Replayability:[/b] Despite the freedom of choice, the overall story doesn’t change significantly in subsequent playthroughs, potentially limiting replay value.

[h3](Not) Recommended for[/h3]
[b]Recommended for:[/b]
• Fans of cyberpunk and dystopian settings.
• Players who appreciate freedom in problem-solving.
• Enthusiasts of deep storytelling and RPG mechanics.

[b]Not Recommended for:[/b]
• Those who prefer fast-paced, action-heavy shooters.
• Players who prioritize modern animations and cutting-edge graphics.

[h3]Final Verdict[/h3]
[b]Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut[/b] is a masterpiece of the cyberpunk genre, delivering a compelling story, player freedom, and a rich atmosphere. While some aspects, such as the AI, animations, and user interface, may feel outdated, the experience remains a stellar example of story-driven RPGs. A must-play for anyone who values philosophical depth in gaming.

183752986.review:
Deus Ex: Human Revolution – A Cyberpunk Masterpiece

For me, this isn’t just the best SIM game—it’s one of the best games ever made. The world, choices, and story are unforgettable.
Adam Jensen’s iconic line, “I never asked for this,” echoes in my mind, especially now in 2024, knowing the next game was canceled. It’s a loss we didn’t deserve, but this masterpiece will always stand as a testament to gaming greatness.

183736933.review:
Thrilling cyber-punk action adventure across a dystopian sci-fi world.

[b][u] STORY - 8/10 [/u][/b]
Loved the story and narrative going across this dystopian world as capitalism and the human condition is challenged by ever evolving technology.


[b][u] GAMEPLAY - 7/10 [/u][/b]
So much fun with the power system upgrading different parts and unlocking new powers and augmentations. Only complaint is the main missions tend to drag out and on beyond the scope of my smooth brain attention span. Its insanely easy to get lost even with adequate navigation tools (I'm looking at you level designer of the Hong Kong map). Also, why is the non-lethal ammo so damn expensive??


[b][u] VISUALS - 7/10 [/u][/b]
Decent visuals in general. Main props go to the UI though. I wish my OS looked like that.


[b][u] MUSIC - 7/10 [/u][/b]
Decent music and OST. A tad bit plain and tropey with generic sci-fi music.


[b][u] EXTRA: TENSION - 9/10 [/u][/b]
Sneaking through each level, uncovering each clue adds SO MUCH tension to the game that often times I end up too nervous to commit to a particular path. Especially since my usual go-to tactic is the Stealth Archer playtype, though I guess here is more a Stealth Sniper. 


[b][u] OVERALL - 7.6/10 [/u][/b]
Enjoyed it and I do recommend for any looking for a good sci-fi action thriller.

183713912.review:
[i]“Чи можемо ми змінити світ, якщо перестанемо бути лише людьми?”[/i]

[b]Рецензія на Deus Ex: Human Revolution — Director's Cut[/b]

[b]Графіка:[/b]

Версія Director's Cut зберігає унікальний візуальний стиль оригіналу: золото-чорна кольорова палітра, неонові відтінки, кіберпанкові міські ландшафти. Хоча суттєвих змін у графіці немає, розширена версія пропонує покращене освітлення та тіні, що додають глибини світу.

Моделі персонажів залишаються незмінними, з їхніми помітно застарілими анімаціями, що дещо контрастує із загальним стилем гри. Незважаючи на це, естетика Deus Ex: Human Revolution залишається чарівною.

[b]Геймплей:[/b]

Director's Cut усуває головну проблему оригіналу — босів. У новій версії їх переробили, додавши можливість проходити бої з використанням стелсу та аугментацій, що робить гру більш цілісною для тих, хто вибрав ненасильницький підхід.

Усі DLC, включно з The Missing Link, інтегровані в основний сюжет, створюючи більш зв'язну історію. The Missing Link додає кілька нових локацій та випробувань, дозволяючи краще дослідити світ і мотивацію персонажів.

Ігровий процес залишається незмінним: свобода вибору між стелсом, боєм чи дипломатією, багатство підходів до виконання місій і можливість адаптувати аугментації до свого стилю гри. Кампанія стала ще цікавішою завдяки розширеним діалогам та новим сюжетним деталям.

[b]Сюжет:[/b]

Основна історія — це дослідження конфлікту між технологічними досягненнями і людяністю. Адам Дженсен, як і раніше, стикається з етичними дилемами та політичними інтригами, досліджуючи змову корпорацій. DLC додає більше деталей, проливаючи світло на мотивацію деяких персонажів і загальний масштаб змови.

[b]Музика:[/b]

Саундтрек Майкла МакКанна залишається сильним елементом гри. Його атмосферні електронні композиції доповнюють кожен момент, створюючи напругу під час боїв і меланхолію під час досліджень. У Director's Cut музика залишається незмінною, але й не потребує покращень — вона ідеальна.

[b]Недоліки:[/b]

Графічні оновлення мінімальні, що може розчарувати гравців, які чекали значного поліпшення.

Деякі локації та місії все ще здаються лінійними.

У повільних моментах геймплей може здаватися трохи монотонним.


[b]Оцінка:[/b]

Deus Ex: Human Revolution — Director's Cut отримує 9/10. Виправлення механіки босів і інтеграція DLC роблять цю версію найкращим способом пережити історію.

[b]Підсумок:[/b]

Director's Cut — це найкраща версія Human Revolution, яка виправляє помилки оригіналу й надає найбільш цілісний досвід. Якщо ви ще не грали в цю гру або хочете повернутися в цей похмурий кіберпанковий світ, саме Director's Cut стане ідеальним вибором.

183602720.review: Wonderful game but a complete dog water port job. Yes, port job. I do not understand why they used the Wii U version of the game. Many textures look notably worse and broken glass effects barely exist compared to the original. However, one of the worst parts has to be the possible crash at the final boss. If you knock out/kill too many civilians, it is possible for your game to crash due to not having enough memory. This means that your entire run is completely bricked if you didn't make a save at the start of the level. I should repeat: this is a review of DXHR as a product, not as an experience. As an experience, it's wonderful and the reason I've nearly 100% it. As a product, it is barely fucking functional. Try and find the original any play that, if you can. Otherwise, I would highly encourage, at minimum, running the patcher and look into using a few visual mods to make the game look better.
